laboratory_examinations.findings: Glucose concentrations above 200 mg per deciliter (11 mmol per liter).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Difficult to achieve control of blood glucose concentration with intravenous insulin.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Low serum insulin and C-peptide concentrations.
Autoantibodies detected on surface of red cells.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Lowest hemoglobin recorded was 6 g per deciliter.
Increased to more than 500 per cubic millimeter on day 11 after transplantation, then to 6500, 3700, 4600, and 4800 over time.
Increased to 331,000; 530,000; 504,000; and 273,000 over subsequent tests.
Moderate hepatitis occurred from day 42 to day 50.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Very high (up to 1750 IU per milliliter [4200 µg per liter]).
Flattened mucous membrane, partial-to-subtotal villous atrophy, numerous T lymphocytes and plasma cells.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Six months after transplantation showed normal villous architecture.
